text.p: Here are the highlights from Swiss newspapers on Friday:

- Goran Lindahl has been appointed new CEO of Swiss-Swedish technology group ABB. The Swedish top manager has been at ABB for the Past 25 years. Former CEO Percy Barnevik will focus on his function as chairman of the board.
- Swiss Minister Kaspar Villiger pleaded for increased willingness to push farming reforms as he opened the Olma, the largest agriculture fair in Sankt Gallen.

- Swiss brush maker Trisa reported a 37.3 percent rise in net profits to 0.7 million Swiss francs in fiscal 1995/96. - Chinese President Jiang Zemin accepted an invitation to visit Switzerland in 1997. The Swiss economics ministry said that the Swiss delegation lead by Swiss President Jean-Pascal Delamuraz had achieved substatial improvements for Swiss companies operating in China.
- The Dutch government said it will seek Nazi gold in Switzerland in its attempt to find some 75 tons of gold that has been missing since the end of World War II.
- French-speaking cantons plan to launch an intitiative that would put health insurance policy under cantonal authority.
Health insurance premiums are substantially higher in Francophone Switzerland than in the German-speaking regions. -- Zurich Editorial +41 1 631 7340
